newsitem.title: USA: Tribune Q1 publishing profit rises.
newsitem.headline: Tribune Q1 publishing profit rises.

text.p: Tribune Co said Friday that operating profit from its publishing business rose 51 percent in the first quarter to $95 million, due mainly to higher advertising revenues and lower newsprint prices.
In the 1996 first quarter its publishing operating profit was $63 million.
"Our publishing group had an exceptionally strong first quarter with better-than-expected revenue growth coupled with lower newsprint prices," John Madigan, Tribune chairman, said in a statement.

First quarter publishing revenues increased eight percent from a year ago, to $355 million. Advertising revenues rose 10 percent due to higher rates and linage, with retail advertising up six percent, general up eight percent and classified up 13 percent.
Newsprint and ink expenses dropped 28 percent in the quarter. Average newsprint prices were down about 30 percent from 1996, while consumption rose five percent.
Other publishing expenses were up seven percent, mainly due to higher compensation costs and increased development of Internet businesses, Tribune said.

Tribune said its first quarter operating profit from broadcasting and entertainment was up two percent to a record $30 million, from $29 million a year ago. Television operating profits rose 23 percent to a record $31 million and were up 21 percent excluding acquisitions.

This was partially offset, however, by an equity loss of $11 million in the WB Network, compared with a loss of $3 million in 1996. Tribune increased its stake in the network to 21.9 percent from 12.5 percent in the 1997 first quarter.

First quarter operating revenues for braodcasting and entertainment rose eight percent, to $201 million from $187 million a year ago, due mainly to a nine percent increase from television, Tribune said.

Television gains were attributed primarily to improvement in Chicago and the acquisition of six television stations from Renaissance Communications last month and of KSWB-San Diego in April 1996. Excluding acquisitions, television revenues rose five percent.
Tribune is a media company with operations in television, radio and publishing, including the Chicago Tribune newspaper.
